message.content:
<<<api>>>: List.get
<<<code>>>: 
Object o = lv1.getItemAtPosition(position);
ItemDetail obj_ItemDetail = (ItemDetail)o;
new AlertDialog.Builder(view.getContext())
.setIcon(obj_ItemDetail.getImageNumber())
.setTitle(obj_ItemDetail.getName())
.setMessage(obj_ItemDetail.getItemDescription() + "\n" + "Price: " + obj_ItemDetail.getPrice())
.setNegativeButton("Close", null).show();
<<<explanation>>>: In the onItemClick method, you can use the List.get method to get the item at the clicked position. This item is an object of the ItemDetail class. You can then use the AlertDialog.Builder to create a dialog that displays the name, description, and price of the item. The icon for the dialog is set to the image number of the item. The dialog has a "Close" button that dismisses the dialog when clicked.

prompt:
Please answer my code questions using the given API following this format: <<<api>>>: $API
<<<code>>>: $CODE
<<<explanation>>>: $EXPLANATION.
Question: How to get the last value of an ArrayList: How to get the last value of an ArrayList?
Please using this api: List.get.
Answer:<<<api>>>: List.get
<<<code>>>: E e = list.get(list.size() - 1);
<<<explanation>>>: First get the size of the list, then the last element is at index size - 1.
Question: How to show arraylist in AlertDialog: :I have a question, how to show this array item_detail to AllertDialog?    //Beri keterangan untuk arrayitem detail    ItemDetail item_detail = new ItemDetail();    item_detail.setName("Cake");    item_detail.setItemDescription("");    item_detail.setPrice("5.000");    item_detail.setImageNumber(1);    result.add(item_detail);    item_detail = new ItemDetail();    item_detail.setName("Coklat");    item_detail.setItemDescription("Bulat");    item_detail.setPrice("5.500");    item_detail.setImageNumber(2);    result.add(item_detail);    item_detail = new ItemDetail();    item_detail.setName("Purple");    item_detail.setItemDescription("Cupcake");    item_detail.setPrice("6.000");    item_detail.setImageNumber(3);    result.add(item_detail);    return result;}}this is my code :public void onCreate(Bundle savedInstanceState) {    super.onCreate(savedInstanceState);    setContentView(R.layout.activity_list_view_image);    ArrayList<ItemDetail> image_detail = GetSearchResult();    final ListView lv1 = (ListView) findViewById(R.id.listV_main);    lv1.setAdapter(new ItemListBaseAdapter(this, image_detail));    lv1.setOnItemClickListener(new OnItemClickListener() {        @Override        public void onItemClick(AdapterView<?> a, View view, int position, long id){            Object o = lv1.getItemAtPosition(position);            ItemDetail obj_ItemDetail = (ItemDetail)o;            new AlertDialog.Builder(view.getContext())            .setIcon(obj_ItemDetail.getImageNumber())            .setMessage(obj_ItemDetail.getItemDescription())            .setNegativeButton("Close", null).show();            Toast.makeText(ListViewImageActivity.this, "Anda Memilih : " + " " + obj_ItemDetail.getName(), Toast.LENGTH_SHORT).show();        }        });    }private ArrayList<ItemDetail> GetSearchResult() {    // TODO Auto-generated method stub    ArrayList<ItemDetail> result = new ArrayList<ItemDetail>();    //Beri keterangan untuk arrayitem detail    ItemDetail item_detail = new ItemDetail();    item_detail.setName("Cake");    item_detail.setItemDescription("");    item_detail.setPrice("5.000");    item_detail.setImageNumber(1);    result.add(item_detail);    item_detail = new ItemDetail();    item_detail.setName("Coklat");    item_detail.setItemDescription("Bulat");    item_detail.setPrice("5.500");    item_detail.setImageNumber(2);    result.add(item_detail);    item_detail = new ItemDetail();    item_detail.setName("Purple");    item_detail.setItemDescription("Cupcake");    item_detail.setPrice("6.000");    item_detail.setImageNumber(3);    result.add(item_detail);    return result;}}
